raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "Parry Romberg syndrome", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "Parry Romberg syndrome (progressive hemifacial atrophy) is a form of localized scleroderma characterized by progressive atrophy of skin and soft tissues on one side of the face. Pierre Robin syndrome is a congenital condition with micrognathia and cleft palate. Gardeners syndrome is a variant of familial adenomatous polyposis. Merkelsson Rosenthal syndrome involves facial paralysis, facial swelling, and fissured tongue. Only Parry Romberg syndrome is classified as a type of scleroderma."}
